title: Worth a try: CEO Ian Ayre replies fan who applied for Liverpool job
text:
15:55 CET Worth a try: CEO Ian Ayre replies fan who applied for Liverpool job - www.allsports.com.gh 
The quest for 'experience' in modern day job search in inevitable. Employers need proof of achievement in similar role even consider your application. 
Well, this Liverpool fan had that in abundance when he applied for the managerial position at the Anfield club after Brendan Rodgers was sacked … or so he thought. 
Success in managing Porthmouth from Second Division to win an astonishing Premier League and Champions League double was a great deal of experience in football management. 
Just that, there was only one problem here … he managed the club on the FIFA 15 computer game, not in real life. 
The Anfield club however did not overlook the application of Adam Kneale. Chief Executive Officer Ian Ayre took time to reply Mr. Kneale telling him why he could not be hired at this time. play
